last_episode_to_air.name: Ask a Human
last_episode_to_air.overview: Time for the big questions, as chosen by the humans themselves. How common are heroes? Do names matter? Above all, what’s proper toilet etiquette?

name: 100 Humans: Life's Questions. Answered.
overview: One hundred hardy souls from diverse backgrounds participate in playful experiments exploring age, sex, happiness and other aspects of being human.

episodes.name: What Makes Us Attractive?
episodes.overview: An interactive element emerges to see what makes humans' sexual psyches hum. Hot dancing? Uniforms? Sperm samples will be collected.

episodes.name: The Best Age to Be Alive
episodes.overview: The hosts make surprising discoveries when 20-, 30-, 40-, 50- and 60-somethings compete against each other in assembling furniture and other tests.

episodes.name: Let’s Talk About Sex
episodes.overview: The battle of the sexes goes under a microscope as the participants disprove multiple myths and confirm others. The experts examine the results.

episodes.name: Are You Biased?
episodes.overview: Ingrained bias sneaks in, prompting subjects to judge others by their accents, fire toy guns at innocent bystanders and underrate their own peers.

episodes.name: Pain vs. Pleasure
episodes.overview: Humans weigh pleasurable prizes against painful penalties as the hosts explore the many ways negative and positive elements shape our reality.

episodes.name: How to Be Happy
episodes.overview: The subjects pursue joy through crafts and catastrophes, partying and watching paint dry. Time flies when they’re having fun, except when it doesn't.

episodes.name: Can You Trust Your Senses?
episodes.overview: Go with your gut? Not always. The hosts learn how noses, eyes and even taste buds are impacted by context and external forces like music — and mimes.

episodes.name: Ask a Human
episodes.overview: Time for the big questions, as chosen by the humans themselves. How common are heroes? Do names matter? Above all, what’s proper toilet etiquette?
